name: Hotel Les Mars, Relais & Chateaux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely gorgeous. Flawless service. Over the top beautiful room. Make a reservation at Cyrus for a once in a lifetime amazing dinner. Splurge on Les Mars for a truly luxurious upscale romantic getaway. It's just a block from town square, which is cute and has some good shopping and other good dining optons.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed several nights last November. Our 15th anniversary and first visit to Sonoma/Napa. Les Mars is one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in, including 'big name' 5-star places on several continents. We especially appreciated the small size and unpretentious elegance; everything had been thought of and was included (okay, appropriate given the prices), all staff were outstanding! Certainly not an inexpensive getaway but absolutely fabulous!
reviews.title: One of the Best, Ever

likes.liked: — Elegance, Quiet, Good location for touring Sonoma Valley.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were looking for a quick getaway within driving distance and stayed one night at Les Mars Hotel in Healdsburg. The experience exceeded all of our expectations!
reviews.title: romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our large beautifully appointed antique room was so luxurious we couldnt decide whether to spend the entrie day in the room and at the pool or to explore the adorable town of healdsburg! We did a little bit of both!
reviews.title: This property is all about LUXURY...

reviews.text: From the moment we checked in we were treated like very important guests from all the staff--from top to bottom! We met the GM, a gracious woman named Katie Ciocca, who is so warm and professional. She poured some exquisite Sonoma Valley wines and offered us cheeses in the library at 5 pm. We met several interesting guests from San Francisco and a couple who flew in for the week's stay on their private jet from Texas.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed one night in February 2009 at Les Mars. Only 16 rooms. Had estate room which was spacious, elegant, quiet. Entire hotel has very high quality period furnishings. Nice artificial fireplace. Large bath with separate shower. Very nice continental breakfast served in room. One block from central plaza.
reviews.title: Elegant Luxury

reviews.text: A really nice place to stay if price is not a concern.
reviews.title: Superb in every way - a luxurious treat
Amazing service, beautiful ambiance, impeccable attention to detail
reviews.text: What a beautiful hotel with impressive service from everyone from the general manager to the concierge and front desk to the housekeepers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ! I'd stayed here three years ago, and wondered if it was still as wonderful. It was !
reviews.title: Very cushy.

likes.disliked: — There was a slight stuffiness. It's VERY traditional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tasteful antiques, marvelously comfortable beds, soundproofed rooms, lovely marble bathrooms with big showers, jacuzzi tubs and a multitude of amenities... Fireplace, flat screen tv, complimentary bottled Voss flat and sparkling water, umbrellas in the armoire, breakfast on a silver tray.... WOW.
reviews.title: Unbelievably amazing reputation easily deserved!

likes.disliked: — I suppose I wish there was a more comprehensive breakfast service, but the continental service provided turned out to be one of the best I'd ever had. I'm totally nit-picking here because the hotel is so amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Certainly not cheap but infinitely worth it; Les Mars is our home away from home when we're in Sonoma. I encourage everyone to come early and often.
reviews.title: A beautiful little gem in Sonoma

likes.liked: — The fantastic property and wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I never think a hotel is perfect. We just spent a weekend at Les Mars hotel and it was perfect. We booked a Salon room on the third floor, which has soaring ceilings and a gas fireplace. The room was beautifully decorated with a bottle of chilled chardonnay waiting for us. But what really impressed us was all the special touches that weren’t so obvious. The bathroom, with Waterworks pewter fixtures, drawers lined with hand-pressed linen cloths, and the Bulgari toiletries that other guests have commented on. The incredible bed that you sink into and never want to leave, with fabulous bed linens and pillows that made my husband say we should replace our bed at home. The complimentary breakfast brought to our room with amazing scones, yogurt with honey, and other delicious pastries and granola. The incredible staff, who were unfailingly polite and helpful. We had dinner two nights in a row at Cyrus, the restaurant connected to Les Mars and one of the top restaurants (along with French Laundry) in the SF Bay area. Cyrus was incredible – we ate in the bar where they serve the full dinner menu. We were blown away by the quality of the food, the inventiveness of the cocktails, and the knowledgeable waitstaff. Les Mars is one of the top three hotels that we have stayed at –the St. Regis NYC and the Four Seasons Hualalai (Big Island) being the other two. When you want to experience a very special moment, stay at Les Mars (and eat at Cyrus).
reviews.title: Best Hotel we have stayed at in years!

reviews.text: As a huge fan of Relais & Chateaux, and many of its properties, I had high expectations when booking a room at Les Mars. Luckily for me, the property, and more importantly, its outstanding staff was more than prepared to out do any expectations I could have had.
reviews.title: Best of the Best
Les Mars Fascists
reviews.text: Obviously, the area is outstanding. Enough said. But, the hotel almost makes you not want to even venture out. The rooms are incredibly decorated, the baths are luxurious (the equal to The Inn at Little Washington) and the beds, are quite literally, the best I have ever laid (or floated if you will) on. If you brave the world outside of your room, the staff will make you feel right at home, as they get you some fresh lemonade and cookies, or, if you join them before dinner they will lead you through a tasting of local wines and outstanding small production cheeses. The staff is very knowledgeable, and makes out stand reservations if you want to go out for dinner...but why would you do that. Not only is the hotel outstanding, but its restaurant is the best you will find in the valley (if not the state). With the entrance right in the lobby, you do not even have to venture outside. But do not get it wrong, this is far from a "hotel restaurant". Cyrus is not only Relais Gourmand, it is Michelin starred. As mentioned, not your average "hotel restaurant". Be prepared to be dazzled. And when you are done there, a (very) short walk will return you to your room where a box of chocolates awaits.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful. Relaxing. Friendly. Outstanding. Everything I have come to expect from the best hotels.
reviews.title: A superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a regular in Healdsburg and was excited to try Les Mars in April. Booked well in advance, we stayed in the Estate King on the 3rd floor for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Very good but not worth the premium price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no doubt the hotel is gorgeous, and the staff was exceptional. But, the only mirror in my almost $700/night room was the one above the sink, which was very slow to drain. I asked the staff to take a look at the sink, and they promptly did and made things a bit better, but still not ideal.
reviews.title: We were treated like royalty. Pampered like babies. Showered with champagne.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Additionally, the shower head produced way too much water than the drain could handle, causing you to stand in an inch of water throughout the shower. The shower door also snapped against one of the joints when opened.
reviews.title: A Gem!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast, delivered to your door every morning, was mediocre at best. I appreciate they don't cook hot meals, but the pastries were so basic and became too repetitive after day 1. I also found it awkward to eat in the room with only a small reading table on which to place the large tray they deliver to your room.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps a different room might change my opinion, but I doubt I would return at these prices.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in the world.

aka: Hotel Les Mars, Relais And Chateaux
description: Opened in May 2005 and created by the Mars family, Les Mars Hotel brings the elegance and unobtrusive service of the finest European family hotels to Northern California. The Mars family follows the philosophy that patrons should be treated more like visiting friends than guests, and upon entering the lobby, visitors are welcomed to the warm smiles of the Swiss-trained hotel staff, unique 17th and 18th century antiques, and a comfort found only at the home of a very good friend.Les Mars Hotel represents a unique family project, a labor of love, and a new dimension of sophisticated, luxury lodging in wine country. Andrew Harper’s Hideaway Report, the definitive guide to luxury travel, commented that "Les Mars now sets the standard for luxury accommodations in Sonoma."
